oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Selected Pages from "The Colored Cadet at West Point: Autobiography of Lieut. Henry Ossian Flipper, U. S. A., first graduate of color from the U. S. Military Academy," 1878
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The cover, title page, and inscription of an 1878 publication titled "The Colored Cadet at West Point: Autobiography of Lieut. Henry Ossian Flipper, U. S. A., first graduate of color from the U. S. Military Academy." Henry Ossian Flipper was an American soldier, former slave and, in 1877, the first African American to graduate from the United States Military Academy at West Point, earning a commission as a second lieutenant in the U.S. Army.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Flipper, Henry Ossian, 1856-1940
Books; African Americans--Military service; African Americans--Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Homer Lee & Co., 1878
